original: @17b # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @17b # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: sarbe shva rar sa y'a na ro ga ha ri sa r'i pushti ka ra n'a ma /
analyzed: sarbe shva rar sa y'a na ro ga ha ri sa r'i pushti ka ra n'a ma /
translated: Sarve≈õvara-rasƒÅyana-rogahara-sarƒ´ra-pu·π£·π≠ikara-nƒÅma

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: thams cad kyi dbang phyug gi bcud len nang thams cad 'joms shing lus kyi stobs rgyas par byed pa zhes bya ba /
analyzed: thams cad kyi dbang phyug gi bcud len nang thams cad 'joms shing lus kyi stobs rgyas par byed pa zhes bya ba /
translated: The Elixir of All Powerful Ones, Which Destroys All Diseases and Increases the Body's Strength

original: thams cad mkhyen pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the Omniscient One!

original: dang po dngul chu sbyang ba'i don du so phag gi phye ma dang sbyar la lan bdun gyi bar du btag cing sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: dang po dngul chu sbyang ba'i don du so phag gi phye ma dang sbyar la lan bdun gyi bar du btag cing sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: First, for the sake of purifying mercury, mix it with brick powder and beat it seven times.

original: de'i skabs su yang nyi ma la bdug par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i skabs su yang nyi ma la bdug par bya'o //
translated: At that time, it should also be fumigated in the sun.

original: shing aa kon gyi 'o mas lan bdun gyi bar du btag cing sbyang bar bya'o //
analyzed: shing aa kon gyi 'o mas lan bdun gyi bar du btag cing sbyang bar bya'o //
translated: Beat and purify it seven times with the milk of the akon tree.

original: de'i stabs su yang nyi ma la bdug par bya'o //üîΩyang shing be 'un gyi 'o mas sngar bzhin no //üîΩkanti zhes bya ba'i shing tsher ma can gyi khu bas sngar bzhin no ;
analyzed: de'i stabs su yang nyi ma la bdug par bya'o // yang shing be 'un gyi 'o mas sngar bzhin no // kanti zhes bya ba'i shing tsher ma can gyi khu bas sngar bzhin no ;
translated: At that time, it should also be fumigated in the sun.üîΩAgain, as before, with the milk of the ve≈Üu tree.üîΩAs before, with the juice of the thorny kanta tree.

original: / ku m'a ra'i khu bas sngar bzhin no //
analyzed: / ku m'a ra'i khu bas sngar bzhin no //
translated: As before, with the juice of the kumƒÅra tree.

original: tsi tra'i khu bas sngar bzhin no //
analyzed: tsi tra'i khu bas sngar bzhin no //
translated: Citraka juice, as before.

original: mdze tsha'i khu bas sngar bzhin no //
analyzed: mdze tsha'i khu bas sngar bzhin no //
translated: The juice of the white yam, as before.

original: sman de rnams bkrus shing dngul chu bzung ngo //
analyzed: sman de rnams bkrus shing dngul chu bzung ngo //
translated: These herbs are washed and mercury is taken.

original: ling gi zhes bya ba'i sman 'dab ma gsum pa /
analyzed: ling gi zhes bya ba'i sman 'dab ma gsum pa /
translated: The herb called Linga has three leaves,

original: ro tsha me tog med pa /
analyzed: ro tsha me tog med pa /
translated: tastes bitter and has no flower.

original: sdong bu mtho gang tsam yod pa'i khu ba rlugs nas btags pas skam zhing skud ba ltar drang du 'dod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sdong bu mtho gang tsam yod pa'i khu ba rlugs nas btags pas skam zhing skud ba ltar drang du 'dod par 'gyur ro //
translated: The juice of the stem, one cubit long, is boiled and taken. It dries up and becomes straight, as desired.

original: zangs sbyong bar 'dod pas srab mor byas la skyur po'i nang du zhag bdun gyi bar du sbang ngo //
analyzed: zangs sbyong bar 'dod pas srab mor byas la skyur po'i nang du zhag bdun gyi bar du sbang ngo //
translated: One who wishes to purify copper should make it thin and steep it in an acidic substance for seven days.

original: dar ba'am chur khu la yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: dar ba'am chur khu la yang de bzhin no //
translated: The same for tin and lead.

original: legs par bkru bar bya'o //
analyzed: legs par bkru bar bya'o //
translated: It should be washed well.

original: de nas zangs dang mu zi mnyam par byas la rdza gong nang du du ba mi 'chor bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas zangs dang mu zi mnyam par byas la rdza gong nang du du ba mi 'chor bar bya'o //
translated: Then, making the copper and lead equal, it should be placed in a clay pot where the smoke does not escape.

original: dngul chu lta bur dkar por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngul chu lta bur dkar por 'gyur ro //
translated: It becomes white like mercury.

original: gsha' tshe sbyong ba la pong gi khu bas sngar bzhin no //
analyzed: gsha' tshe sbyong ba la pong gi khu bas sngar bzhin no //
translated: For purifying mica, the juice of the white yam, as before.

original: lcags gsad par 'dod pas ba'i chu la 'bru gsum btab la srab mor byas la gzhug go //
analyzed: lcags gsad par 'dod pas ba'i chu la 'bru gsum btab la srab mor byas la gzhug go //
translated: If one wishes to kill iron, one should recite the three syllables over water in which rice has been boiled, and pour it into the iron.

original: bcug pa ni bsregs pas so //
analyzed: bcug pa ni bsregs pas so //
translated: The iron will be melted by the heat.

original: phyi nas yang 'bru gsum bcug la zangs bzhin no //
analyzed: phyi nas yang 'bru gsum bcug la zangs bzhin no //
translated: Later, one should recite the three syllables over it again, and it will be like copper.

original: lhang tsher gsad par 'dod pas zhib tu btags la skyur bor bcug la zangs bzhin no //
analyzed: lhang tsher gsad par 'dod pas zhib tu btags la skyur bor bcug la zangs bzhin no //
translated: If one wishes to kill lead, one should grind it to a powder, mix it with sour gruel, and pour it into copper.

original: aa ra dhe'i lo ma ni gnyen po yin te zangs bzhin no //
analyzed: aa ra dhe'i lo ma ni gnyen po yin te zangs bzhin no //
translated: The leaves of ardha are the antidote, and it will be like copper.

original: ba'i lci bas kha mnan par bya'o //
analyzed: ba'i lci bas kha mnan par bya'o //
translated: One should cover it with cow dung.

original: rdo pha wang gsad bar 'dod pas /
analyzed: rdo pha wang gsad bar 'dod pas /
translated: If one wishes to kill stone,

original: kshi ri ka na ta'i lo mas nyi ma la lan bdun bdug par bya'o //
analyzed: kshi ri ka na ta'i lo mas nyi ma la lan bdun bdug par bya'o //
translated: one should grind the leaves of kshirika to a powder, fumigate it with the sun for seven days,üîΩand pour it into the stone.

original: mar khu tshan de bcug ba sngar gyi zangs bzhin no //
analyzed: mar khu tshan de bcug ba sngar gyi zangs bzhin no //
translated: The stone will be like the copper above.

original: dkar por song ba ni 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: dkar por song ba ni 'byed pa'o //
translated: When it becomes white, it will be separated.

original: dngul sbyang bar 'dod pas nir ba si'i khu bas lan bdun gyi bar du lcags bzhin du gsad par bya'o //
analyzed: dngul sbyang bar 'dod pas nir ba si'i khu bas lan bdun gyi bar du lcags bzhin du gsad par bya'o //
translated: If one wishes to purify silver, one should kill it like iron with the juice of nirbhasa up to seven times.

original: ji ltar dngul chu gsad pa bzhin du bi ma la yang gsad par bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar dngul chu gsad pa bzhin du bi ma la yang gsad par bya'o //
translated: Just as mercury is killed, so also bƒ´ja is killed.

original: gser sbyong bar 'dod pas ka tsa na'i ba ji ltar zangs gsod pa bzhin bya'o //
analyzed: gser sbyong bar 'dod pas ka tsa na'i ba ji ltar zangs gsod pa bzhin bya'o //
translated: One should do this like a goldsmith refines gold.

original: ji ltar gser gsod pa bzhin su ba ki ta yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar gser gsod pa bzhin su ba ki ta yang de bzhin no //
translated: Just as one refines gold, one should do the same with svabuka.

original: de ltar sbyangs pa thams cad cha mnyam par byas la /
analyzed: de ltar sbyangs pa thams cad cha mnyam par byas la /
translated: Having thus refined all the ingredients equally,

original: aa ba ni cha gsum mo //
analyzed: aa ba ni cha gsum mo //
translated: avah is one-third.

original: de ltar thams cad zhib tu btags la gong bur bya'o//
analyzed: de ltar thams cad zhib tu btags la gong bur bya'o//
translated: Having thus finely ground everything, one should make a ball.

original: @18a * // nad pa la ra ti bzhi bzhi byin na /
analyzed: @18a * // nad pa la ra ti bzhi bzhi byin na /
translated: If one gives four ratis to a patient,

original: nad thams cad 'phrog go //üîΩskyur po dang sngo spang ngo //
analyzed: nad thams cad 'phrog go // skyur po dang sngo spang ngo //
translated: it will remove all illnesses.üîΩOne should avoid sour and bitter [foods].

original: phye dang khur ba yang spang la /
analyzed: phye dang khur ba yang spang la /
translated: One should also avoid flour and pastries.

original: ra ti bzhi bzhi zla ba drug tu zos na /
analyzed: ra ti bzhi bzhi zla ba drug tu zos na /
translated: Having eaten four ratis for six months,

original: skra dkar dang gnyer ma spong zhing /
analyzed: skra dkar dang gnyer ma spong zhing /
translated: one will eliminate gray hair and wrinkles.

original: tshe nyi zla dang mnyam mo //
analyzed: tshe nyi zla dang mnyam mo //
translated: One's lifespan will be equal to the sun and moon.

original: mtshon gyis mi chod cing bud med la khu ba 'phro bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtshon gyis mi chod cing bud med la khu ba 'phro bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: One will not be cut by weapons, and one's semen will not be lost to women.

original: zla ba drug gi bar du gru la phyin na 'byings pa bsrung ngo //
analyzed: zla ba drug gi bar du gru la phyin na 'byings pa bsrung ngo //
translated: If one goes by boat for six months, it will protect against drowning.

original: dbang phyug gis bstan pa'i rin po che'i bcud len grub pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: dbang phyug gis bstan pa'i rin po che'i bcud len grub pa rdzogs so /
translated: The accomplishment of the precious elixir taught by Mahe≈õvara is complete.

original: // / ha ri dho bar gyi rnal 'byor ba shi ba d'a sha dang / au rgyan pas pu trar bsgyur ba'o//
analyzed: // / ha ri dho bar gyi rnal 'byor ba shi ba d'a sha dang / au rgyan pas pu trar bsgyur ba'o//
translated: The yogi of the later period translated the Abhisamayalamkara-vrtti into Tibetan as the mNgon rtogs rgyan gyi 'grel pa.
